title: help!
content:
Please id this font.  
The part that goes “vote lincoln”  
Thanks so much!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080611163724im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/511314976_a36531a759_4015.jpg)

 [‹ Harold & Maude opening credits](http://web.archive.org/web/20080611163724/http:/www.typophile.com/node/46053 "Go to previous forum topic") [Wired Magazine Title Font ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080611163724/http:/www.typophile.com/node/46045 "Go to next forum topic")
author: L.a.Z.

comments.content: Closest I can get is [Trade Gothic Bold Cond](http://web.archive.org/web/20080611163724/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/linotype/trade_gothic_std_bold_condensed_no_20/?sample_text=VOTE%20LINCOLN&sample_size=74) but that’s not it. Not [Alt Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20080611163724/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/linotype/alternate_gothic_com_no_2/?sample_text=VOTE%20LINCOLN&sample_size=74) or Alpin either.

I’m inclined to say it’s [DIN Engschrift](http://web.archive.org/web/20080611163724/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=din+engschrift&site=d&sample_text=VOTE%20LINCOLN), no?  
F

Oh, silly me. It’s [DIN 1451](http://web.archive.org/web/20080611163724/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/linotype/din_1451_std_engschrift/?sample_text=VOTE%20LINCOLN&sample_size=74). Amazing how similar these few letters are to Trade.
